UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile in the ExamFocus application, holding personal preferences and linking to their data. Authentication details are handled by an external system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity, matching Firebase Auth UID.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user profile was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the user profile was last updated.

Exam.title: Exam
Exam.description: Represents an exam scheduled by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Exam entity.

subject.description: The subject or topic of the exam.

date.description: The scheduled date of the exam in YYYY-MM-DD format.

notes.description: Optional notes related to the exam.

completed.description: Indicates whether the exam has been marked as completed.

totalMark.description: Total possible marks for the exam.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the exam record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the exam record was last updated.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Represents a study resource collection created by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Resource entity.

imageUrl.description: URL for the resource's cover image.

links.description: A list of external links associated with the resource.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the resource was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the resource was last updated.

definition.description: Stores individual user profiles. The document ID (`userId`) must match the authenticated user's UID (`request.auth.uid`).
Contains exams created by a specific user.
Contains study resources created by a specific user.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure uses a top-level `userProfiles` collection where each document ID is a user's UID. All of that user's data (exams, resources) is stored in subcollections under their profile document. This ensures strict data segregation, as security rules can easily check if the `request.auth.uid` matches the `{userId}` in the document path, preventing any user from accessing another user's data.
